How to Install triplea on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • triplea

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install triplea on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing triplea on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall triplea in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install triplea, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install triplea Using apt

To install triplea in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install triplea using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install triplea

The installation of triplea might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install triplea Using apt-get

To install triplea using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install triplea.

sudo apt-get -y install triplea

Install triplea Using Synaptic

To install triplea using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install triplea on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for triplea. This will display the triplea package in the package window, now to install triplea, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the triplea package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of triplea.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install triplea Using aptitude

To install triplea on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of triplea.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install triplea using the command aptitude install triplea.

sudo aptitude -y install triplea

How to Upgrade triplea on debian

If you want to upgrade the triplea package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade triplea using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade triplea to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade triplea.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade triplea sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade triplea

Upgrade triplea using Aptitude

To upgrade triplea using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade triplea.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade triplea

Upgrade triplea using Synaptic

To upgrade triplea using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for triplea, now right-click triplea, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade triplea just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall triplea on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall triplea from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just triplea, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove triplea

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of triplea

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of triplea you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge triplea

Remove triplea using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall triplea using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for triplea, right-click the triplea package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall triplea click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install triplea on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade triplea using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of triplea then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
